reviews.review_msg: Niall for the most part was good, the grading for a few of the assignments was oddly specific and favored quantity over quality but all round good.

Loved the Great Texts series with him. He's honestly my favorite professor at SFU. Be prepared to read lots, write quite a bit, and learn a lot. Don't take them if you don't care about the history of ideas//great thinkers. He made  the seminar structure work really well!
The greatest prof I have ever had!  Difficult class for those students unwilling to admit the privaleges that they have, and those who refuse to do anything about it.  Thank you sir!

Amount of reading was decent (7 books, 2 essays - but SHORT ones), and material was really well connected with social, political, and philosophical issues. Lack of an exam means what you learn is equal to the effort you put in, rather than rote memorization. Reasonably accessible and helpful - encourages discussion, passionate about the humanities.
